items.title: 'Families were coerced': How the regime uses the dead to intimidate in Iran
items.description: As images of rows and rows of dead bodies at a morgue in Tehran circulated, the regime has been accused of making it impossible for families to grieve.

items.title: Religious teaching or discussion may be defence under new hate laws
items.description: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Markets shudder as White House goes to war with everyone
items.description: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

items.title: Multiple fires still burning in Victoria but all warnings downgraded
items.description: Some residents have returned home to take stock of the devastation. Meanwhile, authorities believe the Longwood fire was started by a trailer throwing sparks on the Hume Freeway.

items.title: Australia captain Alyssa Healy retiring from cricket after India series
items.description: Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces she will retire from all forms of cricket after a multi-format series against India in February and March.

items.title: Gazans beg for shelter as winter storms batter millions and Israel limits aid
items.description: Homeless Gazans are begging the Israeli government to allow proper shelters into the strip as winter storms batter the enclave and destroy many people's tents.

items.title: Adelaide Writers' Week is in disarray — how did it reach this point?
items.description: The exclusion of novelist and academic Randa Abdel-Fattah from the upcoming Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted significant fallout in the form of withdrawals by other authors. Here's a look at how the events have unfolded, and how they could continue to.

items.title: Greenland government rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'
items.description: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

items.title: Japan is big on nutrition in child care and has lessons for Australia
items.description: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

items.title: Elite female athletes' struggles with body image and disordered eating
items.description: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

items.title: 'This won't end well': US Fed Reserve chair facing criminal probe
items.description: The US attorney's office in the District of Columbia has opened a criminal investigation into Jerome Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve.

items.title: Police post $1m reward 50 years after Eloise disappeared from bedroom
items.description: Fifty years after an eight-year-old girl vanished from her Beaumaris house, police increase their reward for information from $10,000 to $1 million.

items.title: CCTV released after second person charged over teen's fatal stabbing
items.description: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.

items.title: Where to watch the Golden Globe winners, from streaming to cinema
items.description: The Golden Globes might be over but there are plenty of award-winning films and television to get caught up on.

items.title: Honey for vaginal health? How social ads target women
items.description: There's a whole market online for products to put in or on our genital areas, blurring the lines between hygiene, cosmetics and medicine. This is how they hook in consumers, and how you can check their claims.

items.title: Not-so-young Endeavour readies to hand reins to successor
items.description: For 38 years, it has been "changing young Australian lives one voyage at a time" — but now it is time for the Young Endeavour to make way for its successor.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know Australian geography?
items.description: How well do you know this wide, brown land? Take our quiz.

items.title: 'It's not okay to not talk about it': Kostyuk explains handshake stance
items.description: Marta Kostyuk explained that not shaking Aryna Sabalenka's hand and talking about Ukraine following her Brisbane International defeat was her duty, and to not highlight the issues at home would be "inhumane".

items.title: Big wins for Aussies in first round of Adelaide International
items.description: Daria Kasatkina defeated Greek wildcard Maria Sakkari in straight sets 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 on Monday, while Thanasi Kokkinakis beat American Sebastian Korda.

items.title: Grok blocked in Indonesia and Malaysia as UK launches probe over sexualised images
items.description: The AI platform championed by Elon Musk has come under significant criticism in recent weeks for its production of non-consensual images.

items.title: Rohingya 'targeted for destruction' by Myanmar, ICJ hears
items.description: The case is being watched closely to see how the court might handle other genocide allegations against Israel.

items.title: Adelaide Writers' Week 'hangs in the balance' as Jacinda Ardern joins list of authors boycotting event
items.description: The future of Adelaide Writers' Week (AWW) remains unclear as Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says she is considering her legal options. Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern is among those who will no longer appear at the event.

items.title: More than the US and UK, the Taliban has an issue with Australia
items.description: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

items.title: Man fronts court over duct taped vest near Bondi Beach
items.description: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

items.title: Imam thanks police after alleged roadside assault in Melbourne
items.description: An imam who was allegedly the victim of racial abuse during a roadside assault has thanked the police who helped him and his wife, and urged Australians to reject hate, Islamophobia and antisemitism.
